Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery small neck-amphora; exterior: from left, painted black handle zone; two vertical tongues, one in black and one in added red and part of another red tongue.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd belongs to the same vessel as Reading 26.2.76, 26.2.74-75, British Museum 1965,0930.843, 1965,0930.844, 1965,0930.845, Brighton HA281450.1 and Boston 88.827. It will be from side B. Williams, D. 'In the Manner of the Gorgon Painter: the Deianeira Painter and Others’, in H. A. G. Brijder, A. A. Drukker and C. W. Neeft (eds) Enthousiasmos. Essays on Greek and Related Pottery presented to J. M. Hemelrijk, 1986, 61-68, esp. 62-65, fig. 4. The Ures (CVA Reading I, 39) published the sherd as Clazomenian.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 39, pl. 23, no. 38)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0013) (Phase 1)
